newsitem.title: RUSSIA: LUKoil 97 profits by Russian accounts could fall.
newsitem.headline: LUKoil 97 profits by Russian accounts could fall.

text.p: Russia's largest oil producer LUKoil may see profits, by Russian accounting standards, slip in 1997 due to increased development spending, Vice-President Leonid Fedun said on Thursday.
"It is difficult to say, but it (net profit) could be a little bit lower than last year, because we are putting so much into development," he told Reuters in an interview.
He declined to comment whether profits calculated by international accounting standards would rise or fall this year.
A LUKoil spokesman emphasised that a planned issue of level-three American Depositary Receipts towards the end of the year could provide a substantial part of development costs.

OAO Neftyanaya Kompaniya LUKoil made over three trillion roubles in net profits in 1996, after 2.4 trillion in 1995, according to Russian accounting standards, which are calculated primarily for tax purposes and not for investment consideration.
